text: What does a really good CV include?

I have got offers for work experience and I am planning to teach In a primary school near me which will include teaching year 6 students english and maths. 
They require a CV and i would need to attend a formal interview along with it. 
How should i prepare for this?
And what should my CV include?
A good CV does two things - firstly, demonstrate your relevant experience, secondly, show that you are someone that they would like to work with.

For experience: relevant qualifications and work experience that you have. Early on, any work experience is good to show that you have the drive and commitment to turn up and do the work, but any experience teaching or leading youth groups etc would be good

for the second point, this may be more my personal preference when I am hiring, but I like to know that someone is interested in things outside of work, and again, that can show commitment and provide a good way to talk about the skills and experiences you have had through your hobbies rather than work.

Overall, remember that your CV may be the first impression someone gets of you, so it has to be well written, no mistakes, consistently formatted and look professional. That will then set the tone for your further interactions.
Happy to take a look and provide comments if you want.

Understood.

As ive told you before.. I participated in the TFL (transport for london) project where I will work as a team to innovate the london's bus transport system. I am now elected as the person who calculates all the Finance the TFL will need in order to take our innovation on a another level.

Yes, you should say it is something you are currently doing, as it is relevant and provides a talking point for interview
